column2:
Actor’s portfolio lists 191 web-injects targeting organizations in 25 countries","

This is an Activity Update on the actor
column4: (aka ((Validol-hack)), ((Niko777)), ((ChestoooR)) ), whom we have been tracking since May 2017, as a prolific vendor of web-injects for major mobile malware strains (see: Similar Reports section).

column1: On Aug. 26, 2019, our sensitive and reliable source reached the actor
column3: at the Telegram ID ((@val1dolik)) and collected the following updates:
tailored web-injects for the Anubis Android bot and reported they can be customized for any Android malware on the market, including the&nbsp
column4: recently announced Cerberus Android banking bot.

column2: The actor offered a service to set up the Anubis Android bot and install web-injects into the bot control panel for clients who purchased a subscription.
The actor provided our source with a link to a private Telegram chat room at ((@validol1k)) catering to the actor&rsquo
column3: s clients and promised to post updates&nbsp
column4: and important announcements there. Our sensitive and reliable source gained insight into the channel and reported 39 members were registered, which can be considered the approximate number of clients. Our source was unable to provide a list of members since their IDs were hidden.

column2: According to our source, the actor&nbsp
column4: was short of funds and offered to sell a subscription for the&nbsp
column5: full pack of web-injects for US $1,100, with roughly a 25-percent discount.

column1: Through the course of the current research, we confirmed the results of our previous analysis which identified
column5: Mardanyan)) ). Our source obtained and provided the actor&rsquo
column6: s Telegram ID avatar that depicts a man holding a ball in front of a basketball hoop (see: Attachment 004.png). The same photo was used in&nbsp
column10: VKontakte (VK) Russian social media networking profile at ((vk.com/bcaa3)) (see: Attachment 005.png).&nbsp

column4: recent update suggests the Anubis Android bot remains a popular tool for threat actors attacking mobile users,
column5: even though its author, the actor ((maza-in)), abandoned the project
column6: allegedly after an arrest in March 2019. For example, the actor ((DukeEugene)) acknowledged using
column9: web-injects with a modified Anubis bot, which has&nbsp
column10: a Google Play Protect circumvention mechanism implemented. We recently reported the actor ((<strong>Constantin))&nbsp
column12: such malware (see: https://titan.intel471.com/report/a047407fcd2863b3ea614961a6537df7). However, it is unclear whether&nbsp

column4: s own web-inject development service. A review of the actor&rsquo

column1: Through the course of our research, we also identified a complaint filed by
column3: against the actor ((stronholdem)) at the Jabber ID ((barmik@xmpp.org.uk)), who allegedly owed
column5: US $400 as payment for a subscription. As a result,&nbsp

column1: According to the most recent update, the subscription for the actor&rsquo
column2: s service includes 186 web-injects impacting organizations in 25 countries, and five web-injects targeting social media and financial applications.

From Aug. 19, 2019, to Aug. 25, 2019, the actor ((Validolik)) posted the following at the Exploit forum:

column1: Добавление в панель анубиса сортировка ботов по: Банкам, Пустышкам, Запасные, В архиве, В работе.
